org.metrobots.subsystems

Class Shooter

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem
      • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.PIDSubsystem
        • org.metrobots.subsystems.Shooter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NamedSendable, Sendable

    public class Shooter
extends PIDSubsystem
    Shooter mechanism for Metrobot
    Uses PID Controller to control shooter speed
    Feb 5: Refactored shooter to use PIDSubsystem, utilizing the built in PID controller. Also, added Javadocs - Cameron

      Returns the current RPM of the shooter

      Returns the setpoint(aka target speed) of PID controller

      void usePIDOutput(double output)

      • Shooter

        public Shooter(SpeedController flywheelMotor,
               SpeedController feederMotor,
               OpticalEncoder opticalEncoder)
        Shooter object
        Parameters:
        flywheelMotor - motor for the flywheel
        feederMotor - motor used to feed fuel into flywheel
        opticalEncoder - encoder used for speed control of flywheel

    • Method Detail

      • feed

        public void feed(boolean feed)
        Feeds fuel into shooter
        Parameters:
        feed - boolean which tells robot whether or not it should feed fuel into the shooter

      • launchWhenReady

        public void launchWhenReady()
        Sends a boolean to feed, depending on whether the flywheel is up to speed or not

      • setTargetSpeed

        public void setTargetSpeed(int targetRPM)
        Changes setpoint(aka target speed) of PID controller
        Parameters:
        targetRPM - RPM that we want the flywheel to spin at

      • getTargetSpeed

        public double getTargetSpeed()
        Returns the setpoint(aka target speed) of PID controller
        Returns:
        setpoint of shooter PID

      • getRPM

        public double getRPM()
        Returns the current RPM of the shooter
        Returns:
        shooter RPM

      • setTolerance

        public void setTolerance(double percent)
        Sets the percent that the RPM can be off to still be considered a 'correct' RPM
        Parameters:
        percent - percent that the RPM can be off of the target and still be considered on target (aka deadband)

      • returnPIDInput

        public double returnPIDInput()
        Sensor value that is sent to the PID controller
        Specified by:
        returnPIDInput in class PIDSubsystem
        Returns:
        shooter RPM

      • usePIDOutput

        public void usePIDOutput(double output)
        Sets the motor speed to the PID output, divided by the max RPM, since PID will return value between 0 and maxShooterRPM
        Specified by:
        usePIDOutput in class PIDSubsystem
        Parameters:
        output - speed to set motor, but takes an RPM rather than value from 0.0-1.0. This is then scaled to value from 0.0-1.0
